There is nothing to be done about the 2 !Cs you've already lost, and the !D loser is also inescapable. So you cannot afford a !S loser which means you will have to find the !SK with East and finesse him out of it.
That won't be a problem, will it?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
No, no problem. You will probably have to finesse twice so you will need two dummy entries, but the trump suit will provide both of those, the !HA and !H7, as long as you saved your !H5 for the second entry. Wait a minute, you surely didn't ruff that !C with your !H5 did you? Surely you ruffed with the !H8?
So, you ruffed the !C with the !H8, pulled one round of trumps with the !HK, pulled the last trump by playing !H9 to !HA and finessed the !S. Then !H5 to !H7, finesse the !S a second time. Play !SA and ruff the fourth !S in dummy.
Click NEXT to see it all. [NEXT]
Ask yourself if you would have done the correct thing at the table, say playing for the Bermuda Bowl championship.

Auction: 1D pass 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S5. 
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 5 Total = 9
Wow! The winners add up to 9 already. We have assumed that !Cs will split no worse than 3-1, which is exactly how they do split. Is there any other pitfall you might need to worry about?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Just one minor problem. The !Cs will block if you are not careful!So you win the !SA, then play dummy's !CQ. Next you play dummy's !C8 to your !CK. Then your !CA on which you put dummy's !C7. Aha! Now when you play your !C6 you will be able to keep the lead.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
As they are, though, the contract is cold. But only if you are a good bridge player!

Auction: 2C pass 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S5. 
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 3    !H = 1  !D = 1    !C = 2 Total = 7
Needing two winners you will naturally consider your 5-card !C suit. After unblocking the !C A K you will need two entries to your hand; one to lead the !CJ and drive out the !CQ, then a second to enjoy your good !Cs.
The !S suit will provide one entry easily, but should you depend on the !HQ for the second entry?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
No, for two reasons. Firstly the !HQ only gives you a 50% chance of being an entry. But more importantly, you already have your two sure entries in !Ss. As long as you take the first trick with dummy's !SA both your !SK and  !SJ can be entries.
Win the !SA. Play off dummy's !C A K. Lead the !S9 to your !SJ. Play your !CJ (and another one if necessary) to establish the !C suit. Win whatever red card they play next with dummy's Ace. Play the !SQ to your !SK and cash your established !C(s). Dummy's other red Ace will be your ninth trick.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
You'd have to be very careless to miss this one.

Auction: pass pass 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !C5. You play low from dummy and East plays the !C6. 
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 1  !D = 4?    !C = 3 Total = 9
Although you have 4 !D winners, getting to the last couple might not be so easy. You can make 3 !D tricks simply by winning your !DA, then overtaking your !DJ with dummy's !DQ. But you need that fourth !D winner. Can you get it?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Sure you can, by creating an entry in !Cs. It is likely from the opening lead, (and East's play of a small card), that West has led from !C Q T 7 5. If you win the first trick cheaply then you will still make your !C A K for three !C tricks in all.
So don't win cheaply, win the first trick with the !CA. Then unblock your !D A J. Next play !CK. (on which East discards), and a small !C toward dummy's !C J 9. You are sure to have a !C entry to dummy's !Ds, and you will still get three !C tricks, just a different three.
Clickfor the full Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
You probably would have played the hand the same way you just did, unblock !Ds, then play !C A K and a low !C toward the !C J 9 trying to get a !C entry to dummy.
It is only because the !C opening lead gives you the chance for a Cheap-Trick that you are tempted to go wrong.

Auction: pass pass 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !SQ. East plays the !SK, then the !S2 when you hold up. 
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 0  !D = 4    !C = 1 Total = 6
You are going to have to be pretty lucky to make this contract. You cannot touch the !H suit because a defender would take the !HA and it would start raining !Ss.
So you will have to get 3 extra !C winners, which means the !C finesse absolutely MUST work.
In addition to lucky, you are going to have to be pretty good, too. You will surely have to finesse the !Cs at least twice; that means you need two dummy entries. Can you find them?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Maybe in !Ds. Play the !DK, then !DQ, watching the defender's cards carefully. When both follow twice you know there is only a single !D left out, so you play the !DJ to dummy's !DA. Now take the !C finesse. It works! Next play your !D5 to dummy's !D6 and take another !C finesse. Both defenders follow so your !Cs are good.
Click NEXT to see the full deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Then your chance of success goes way down. You would have to find East with the doubleton !CK.

Auction: 2C | pass 2S pass 3C | pass 3NT pass 6C | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 6!C. West leads the !DQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 0    !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 0 Total = 3
Partner's hand didn't turn out to be what you hoped for, you had in mind maybe the !HK and !DQ.
But this is what you got. First, be thankful West led a !D rather than a !H. Second, see if you can find a way to fight yourself over to dummy and those three beautiful !Ss.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
You have two possibilities for a !C entry, but you can only try one of them as you will see.
You can play a high !C and hope somebody plays the singleton !CT. Then your !C9 would be an entry. If this works you would probably make all 13 tricks, but the chances are very slim.
You can play a low !C to dummy's !C8. Assuming a defender takes the !CT you can win his return and enter dummy with the !C9. This play is guaranteed to give you the entry and is the one you should choose.
Click NEXT to see the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
When you are missing 4 cards the probability of a 3-1 split is about 50%.
But the singleton can be any one of four cards - in this case it can be the !CT, !C6, !C3 or !C2. So the chance of one of the opponents holding specifically the singleton !CT is only one-fourth of 50%, about 12.5%.

Auction: 1H | pass 2C pass 3H | pass 4H pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 4!H. West leads the !SA, then !SK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 1    !H = 0  !D = 3?    !C = 0 Total = 4?
This is the kind of hand that can get really messy if you aren't careful. You could ruff the !S, then try to ruff some !Ds, but the defense can prevent you by leading trumps when you give up the !D tricks. 
All in all a much better plan is to use dummy's !C suit after you unblock the Ace. The only flaw with that idea is that when you ruff the !S, unblock the !CA, then play two rounds of trumps ending in dummy, there will still be a trump left out. And the defender might ruff a !C before you can take the discards you need. Do you see a way around this?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Do NOT ruff the second !S in dummy, just discard a !D. If West plays a third !S you will ruff in your hand, then unblock the !CA, then pull trumps in 3 rounds ending in dummy. And run all those !C tricks. If West plays a trump or a !C the result will be the same. The defense can get one !D trick if they take it right now, but you still make your contract.
Click NEXT to see the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]

Auction: 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !C3, East plays the !CA.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 2 Total = 6
You have the possibility of one additional !S winner if West holds the !SK. However, !Ds is your best suit and if East holds the !DK you could gain all three winners that you need from that suit. But of course you need perhaps 2 dummy entries. Do you have them?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Well, you probably do. West's small !C lead probably indicates an honor, and with East playing the !CA you can be pretty sure that West holds the !CJ. So by playing your !CK underneath the !CA you set up a second entry to dummy via the !C finesse.
Assume East now plays a !H. Take your !HA and play a !C to dummy's !CT. Lead a !D and finesse the !DJ, which holds. Play another !C to dummy and finesse another !D. Now play your !DA and smile when the !DK drops and your fourth !D becomes a winner.
Click NEXT to see the full Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
By unblocking the !CK you were still pretty confident that you would get the two tricks, but the bonus was in the extra dummy entry your unblock created.

Auction: 1S | pass 2C pass 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !D5, East plays the !DQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 0    !H = 3  !D = 1    !C = 1 Total = 5
You must take the !DK right now or you might lose the first 5 tricks.
It's a shame about that solid !S suit, but if you try to win even a single !S they will grab the !SA and win enough !D tricks to set the contract.
So you are going to have to win a lot of !C tricks, and do so without losing the lead. You need dummy entries, and they must be in !Hs.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Win the !DK. Play the !HJ to dummy's !HQ. Play the !CQ and when East follows with a low card let it ride. Still in dummy, play the !CJ, again letting it ride when East plays low. Play one more !C to your !CA, picking up East's !CK this time.
The !C suit is ready to run, so play your !HK to dummy's !HA and take your !C winners. You took 9 tricks in all, the !DK, the !H A Q and all 6 !Cs.
for the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Since it gave you all 6 !C tricks the sacrifice was well worth it.

Auction: 1D | pass 1S pass 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !H4, you play low in dummy and East plays the !H8.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 0    !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 2 Total = 5
The winners list looks a little skimpy, but what a nice solid !S suit. It will be a cinch to establish 4 winners in the suit - if only you have an entry to reach them.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
You are probably getting good at this by now. The way to make sure of a dummy entry is to pass up the Cheap Trick !H9 and win the first trick with the !HA. Since East did not play third-hand-high he probably doesn't have a high card to play. You are confident that West has led from the !HK so by taking the !HA at once you guarantee you can get back to dummy when you need to do so.
After you win the !HA you start on !Ss, and they hold-up their !SA for one round. But you can get to dummy and the rest of the !Ss by leading toward the !HQ.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Here's a question: How many times at the table have situations like this presented themselves but you didn't realize it? And of course, at the table there is no second page popping up to tell you what you should have done.

Auction: 1D 1NT | pass 2NT pass 3NT | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S9, and East plays the !SK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 3    !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 0 Total = 6
I'll bet you got this one. The extra !C tricks you need are winnable only if you can get back to your hand after knocking out the !CA. But the only possible entry card is the !SA. If you use it on the first trick the Defense will hold up their !CA for one trick and your hand will be shot..
So let East keep the first trick, (sacrificing one !S winner), and take the next !S in dummy. Then establish !Cs.
 You sacrifice one !S trick for four !C tricks. A good deal.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
There are two basic types; one where you give up a winner to gain an entry, and this type where you get the entry without giving up a thing.
It looks a little different, but the theme is the same. PROTECT YOUR ENTRY.

Auction: 1NT | pass 2NT pass 3NT | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !H3, you play dummy's !HJ and East plays the !HQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 0    !H = 1  !D = 4    !C = 1 Total = 6
Unless you want to go down really, really early you had better take your !HK right now. And unless you want to go down almost as early you'd better stay completely away from the !S suit. So that only leaves you the !C suit to get 3 more winners in. East will have to have !CK so you can finesse it. You are also going to have to be smart with entries. Got it?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
If East has just !C K x then one finesse, followed by the !CA to drop the !CK and a small !C back to dummy will give you the 4 !C winners you must have. But if East has !C K x x and refuses to cover then you will be able to establish the !Cs but will need an extra dummy entry to enjoy that last winner.
So win the !HK and play the !D K Q. If both defenders follow suit you can afford to overtake your !DJ with dummy's !DA. Now play the !CT and let it ride. If it holds the trick play another !C to your !CJ and then play the !CA, dropping East's !CK.
Enter dummy by playing your !D3 to the !D6 and take your established !C for the ninth trick.
Clickfor the full Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
With only one outside entry to dummy your choices are limited.
You might play East for !C K x and lead a small to your !CJ, then play !CA.
Or you might try leading the !CQ hoping that East will see this as a time to "cover an honor with an honor".

Auction: 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !C4, you play dummy's !C5 and East plays the !C7.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 0  !D = 2    !C = 3 Total = 6
You'd really like to find 3 winners without broaching that !H suit, so you decide to pin your hopes on the !S finesse. But you have a problem. When you win the first trick with the !C9 your only safe entry to dummy is by leading your !CK to the !CA. And this uses up one of your !C winners! Do you see a way to avoid the problem?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Don't win the first trick with the !C9, win with the !CK. Then at trick two enter dummy by playing your !C9 and finessing the !CJ! You are pretty sure West has led from the !CQ so you expect this to work. Then play the !ST, underplaying your !S8. You had better cash the !CA next, then the !SQ, letting it ride if not covered. Finally, one last !S finesse gives you 4 !S winners.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Here it doesn't actually create an extra entry, it just preserves the one entry you have but saves you an actual trick.
Here is an interesting point. Suppose that West's opening lead had been a !H and East had taken the first four !H tricks then played a !D. You would have played the hand the same way! Take the !CK, then finesse the !CJ.

Auction: 2C | pass 2D pass 3D | pass 3H pass 3NT | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !SQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2    !H = 1  !D = 2    !C = 0 Total = 5
There they are, four perfectly good !H tricks and no straightforward way to reach them. On the other hand, (I should say "In the other hand"), you have the possibility of 6 !D tricks, if the !DQ drops, in which case you won't need the !H tricks at all. Can you work those two possibilities into a strategy?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Sure. The !D problem is that the outstanding !Ds may split 3-1 with one defender holding !D Q x x. So it would appear you could only get 5 !D winners. But you can thwart him like this.
Win the !S. Unblock the !HA. Now play the !DJ. If Mr. !D Q x x takes this trick dummy's !DT will become an entry to those wonderful !Hs. But if he cleverly refuses to win the !DQ, then it will fall under your !D A K and you will get all 6 !D tricks.
Clickfor the full Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Maybe after the hand is over he will appreciate it more and congratulate you.

Auction: 2C pass 2S | pass 3H pass 3NT | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !D2.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 2  !D = 3    !C = 2 Total = 8
The reason the Winners list shows 1 !S is that the defenders are going to have to let you win dummy's !SK. If they take that then you'll have 4 !S winners in your hand!
So you only need one more winner really, and if you guess the !C finesse right you will have it. Which way will you finesse, and why?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
You will finesse through East. If he has the !CQ you will win all 3 !C tricks, but if West has the !CQ you may win even more. Just watch.
Win the opening !D lead in dummy. Play the !SK which the defenders are not about to take while you have a !C entry to your hand. Now play the !CT and pass it to West. If West takes the !CQ then you will have TWO entries to your hand, one to get there for a !S lead, and the other to reach the !S winners after you have driven out the !SA. But if West DOESN'T take the !CQ, or if East actually has it, then you will have 3 !C tricks and your contract.
Clickfor the full Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]

Auction: 2C | pass 2H pass 2NT | pass 6NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 6NT. West leads the !ST.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2    !H = 5  !D = 2    !C = 1 Total = T
You need two more winners and the best bet is to try to pick up three !C tricks. You will need the !CK and !CQ to lie in different hands, or both of them to be with East. That is about a 75% chance.
But you may need to make 3 finesses, so that means 3 entries to dummy, all of which must be in the !H suit. Can it be done?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Of course it can. Win the !S lead in your hand and play the !HK, overtaking with dummy's !HA. Now play a !C to your !C9, which loses to West's !CK. West plays another !S.
Now play the !HT, and when West follows you are safe to overtake with dummy's !HJ since you can tell that East did not start with 4 !Hs. In fact, East shows out so it is West who started with 4 !Hs but that won't be a problem for you. Play another !C from dummy, finessing the !CT which wins.
Now play your !H3 toward dummy, finessing the !H8 when West follows with a low card. Play dummy's two !H winners, discarding !Ds,  then the low !C to your !CJ. Wow.
Click NEXT to see the full Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
And as you have figured by now, assessing how many entries you are going to need is big part of that plan. Like here, if you had won a single !H trick in your hand then you wouldn't have had the three entries to dummy.

Auction: 2C | pass 2H pass 2S | pass 3H pass 6S | pass pass pass
Analysis:
Pretty bold bidding by South, but partner DID make a positive response. South is to play 6!S. West leads the !DQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 0    !H = 0  !D = 2    !C = 1 Total = 3
OK, the plan is to get over to dummy for those two !H winners.
If you just play a small !C toward the !CQ that will work whenever West holds the !CK.
How about playing !CA an a small !C, planning on ruffing your third !C to get to dummy? Naaah. They will win the second !C and play a trump.
There is actually a play that is T0% certain, no matter who holds the !CK.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Win the opening lead and lay down your !CJ. The defense is helpless. If they take the !CJ with the !CK, then you have a dummy entry in the form of the !CQ. If they refuse to take the trick you will counter by next laying down the !CA, then ruffing a third !C to get to dummy and the two golden eggs.
Click NEXT to see the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
My dream is that someday I will get a chance to use it at the table. If you ever do be sure and email me.

Auction: 1H pass 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !SJ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 3     !H = 1  !D = 0    !C = 1 Total = 5
You need 4 more winners, and they will come from the !D suit once you have knocked out the !DA. But there is one danger to avoid - if the defenders don't take the !DA on the first round dummy won't have a !D to lead back to your hand. So to make sure you have an entry back you win the first trick with dummy's !SK, saving your !SQ.
Click NEXT to see the hands. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:SK,S:S3]
Next start playing !Ds, first !DQ, then !DK. Assume the defenders take their !DA on the second round.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:DQ,N:D3,S:DK,S:D4]
Win whatever they now play and come to your hand with the !SQ to enjoy your three established !Ds for 9 tricks total.
Click NEXT to see the complete deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Just don't foul up on your !S entry.

Auction: 1S | pass 2S pass 4S | pass pass pass
Analysis:
You were counting on North to have a little better hand than that!South is to play 4!S. West leads the !S6, East plays !S4.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 0     !H = 2  !D = 0    !C = 2 Total = 4
You must find a place for one of those losers and that will mean establishing the !D suit. If !Ds split 3-3 that will be pretty easy so you should plan to deal with a 4-2 split. Dummy entries are limited so win the first trick in your hand with the !SA.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:S2,S:SA]
Before you pull any trumps you start on the !Ds by playing !DA, !DK and then ruffing a !D with the !SK. West follows to the first two, then discards a !H.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:DK,N:D6,N:D3,S:SK,S:DA,S:D5]
Play a small trump to dummy's !ST (East shows out) and ruff another !D with the !SJ.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:ST,N:D7,S:SJ,S:S3]
Dummy's last !D is now good. Play a !S to the !SQ, (pulling West's last trump), and discard a !H or !C loser on the !D8.
Clickfor the complete deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
And once again you had to pay close attention to entries.

Auction: 1NT | pass 2C pass 2S | pass 3NT all pass
Analysis:
North's !C bid was Stayman, but he didn't match !Ss. South is to play 3NT. West leads the !DJ, East plays !DK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2     !H = 1  !D = 2    !C = 3 Total = 8
With the !DK onside you have 8 tricks, and only need one more. If !Cs split 3-3 you can get 2 extras and make an overtrick. But when you are missing 6 cards they are more likely to be 4-2 than 3-3. Since you only need 4 !C tricks you should establish the suit with a duck.
Win the !DA and play a small !C from each hand.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:D6,N:C3,S:DA,S:C2]
The defense gets a cheap trick in !Cs but you don't mind because you still have a small !C for an entry to dummy. You win whatever they return and take the rest of your winners, including 4 tricks in !Cs!
Clickfor the complete deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]

Auction: 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !H5, East plays the !H2.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:HT,S:H3]
Winners:   !S = 2     !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 2 Total = 7
You are very lucky. Apparently West led from !H K Q so you won an undeserved !H trick. Now, if !Cs split 2-2 you can make 12 tricks!But hold it a minute. If you play dummy's two top !Cs and they DON'T split 2-2 you will only  win two !C tricks and the contract will fail. Instead you should play a small !C from dummy right now. The defenders will win the trick easily, but you will win their return and you will still have a !C to get to dummy's 6 !C winners!
for the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]

Auction: 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S2, East plays the !SJ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2     !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 2 Total = 7
You need two more winners and dummy's !Dsuit is your only hope. IF !Ds split 3-2 and IF the defenders don't take too many winners in their suit(s) you can establish !Ds by ducking twice.
Win the first !S. If you hold up they might pocket the !S trick and switch to another suit where you only have two stoppers.
Next play a small !D from each hand. Win the return (probably a !S) and duck a second !D.
If the defenders can only take 2 !S tricks now you are home-free since dummy's 3 !Ds are now established.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
But in fact you were pretty sure they were going to do so. Since West's !S2 was probably his fourth-down then he couldn't have a fifth-down.

Auction: 1NT | pass 2D pass 2H | pass 3NT all pass
Analysis:
North's 3!D bid was a transfer to !Hs. South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S2.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2     !H = 0  !D = 2    !C = 1 Total = 5
Obviously you need to establish 4 !H winners and by driving out the !HA you can manage that handily. The problem is that dummy has only one sure entry, (the !SA), and the defenders may be good enough to hold up their !HA twice.
To assure the contract you should win the first trick in your hand with the !SK. Then play !HQ, !HJ overtaking with dummy's !HK so you can continue establishing the suit while you still have that !S entry.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]

Auction: 1C pass 1S | pass 2S pass 4NT | pass 5H pass 6S | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 6!S. West leads the !HK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 0     !H = 1  !D = 1    !C = 0 Total = 2
One of the two red losers must be discarded on dummy's !C suit. So you pull trumps, taking two rounds, with !SK and !SQ. Then play two top !Cs and ruff a !C. When West shows out on the third !C, enter dummy with a trump and ruff another !C. Dummy's final !C is now established, so enter dummy with another trump and discard one of the red losers on the fifth !C.
Clickfor the full Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]

Auction: 1NT | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 1NT. West leads the !D6, taken by East with the !DJ. East next plays the !DQ on which West plays the !D2. East plays the !D9 which you finally win.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 0     !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 3 Total = 6
You only need one more winner and you have several possibilities. The !H finesse might work, or the !Cs might split 3-3. But you need to consider the defenders winners also. They have already scored 2 !D tricks and will get 2 more as soon as they gain the lead. (The spot cards told you that West has a 5-card !D suit.) Plus they have the 2 top !Ss which they can take whenever they like. So if your play sets up just one more trick for them you will go down.
No, you must establish !Ss, the suit where they have 2 winners anyway. So you play a !S which West wins. He takes his 2 !Ds but you are now home free. When you gain the lead again you will get your !S winner established and only lose 2 !Ss and 4 !Ds.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
If you had played 3 rounds of !Cs you would have gone down with the defenders winning 4 !Ds, 1 !C and 2 !Ss.
Only by establishing !Ss can you make the contract.

Auction: 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S9, taken by East with the !SA. East next plays the !S4.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2     !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 3 Total = 8
You only need one more winner and if !Ds split 3-3 you can easily establish a trick in that suit. But what if !Ds split 4-2? If the !CJ falls you can get an extra !C trick. In fact, no matter how the !Cs are arranged you can establish your extra trick there.
First make sure that you win the second trick with the !SK, keeping dummy's !SQ for a later entry. Then play !CK, and !CQ overtaking with dummy's !CA. Then play the !CT, losing to the !CJ but establishing the !C9 while you still have the !SQ as an entry.
Clickfor the complete deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]

Auction: 1NT | pass 2C pass 2H | pass 2NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 2NT. West leads the !CK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1     !H = 3  !D = 2    !C = 1Total = 7
You need to find another winner and the chances are not good. If either black suit splits 3-3 you can establish dummy's fourth card in that suit. But with West's opening lead of the !CK it is unlikely that !Cs will split. So your only slim hope is that the !Ss split 3-3 and dummy's fourth !S will be a winner.
Win the first trick and play a !S to the !SA. Then play another !S. The defense will win and probably take some !C tricks . When they have finished and play a red card, you win it and play a third round of !Ss. If both defenders follow to all three !Ss then dummy's !S8 is now a winner.
Click NEXT to see the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Next time they probably won't and you'll go down.

Auction: 1H | pass 3H pass 4H | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 4!H. West leads the !CK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 1     !H = 0  !D = 2    !C = 3Total = 6
Obviously you don't really have 6 losers since some of those !Ds and !Cs can be ruffed in dummy. But if you are playing against competent defenders you will only be able to ruff two of them because every time they get the lead they will play a trump. So you must figure on ruffing 2 losers and establishing dummy's fifth !S for a discard of the other one.
Win the !CA and immediately play your !SQ. The defense will win this trick and probably play a trump. Be sure to win this in dummy and then ruff a !S with a high !H. Now exit with a !C. They will win and probably play another trump. Win this one in dummy also, breathing a sigh of relief when !Hs split 2-2. Ruff another !S with your second-last trump, then play !DA and concede a !D. 
Whichever minor suit the defense plays next you ruff in dummy, then ruff the fourth !S, establishing dummy's !S8 while you still have a trump left in dummy. Dummy is now high.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
But that was your best shot.

Auction: 2C | pass 2H pass 3C | pass 3NT pass 4NT | pass 5D pass 5NT | pass 6H pass 7C | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 7!C. West leads the !DQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 1     !H = 0  !D = 0    !C = 0Total = 1
It should be very clear that the only way to get rid of that !S loser is to discard it on dummy's !H suit. So after taking the first trick with dummy's !DA you could pull trumps, then play !HA, !HK and ruff a !H. IF the !Hs split 3-3 you could then enter dummy with the !DK and discard your loser.
The problem is that the !Hs are much more likely to split 4-2, in which case you will need to ruff twice to establish a winner. That means you will need an extra entry to dummy. 
That extra entry can only be the !CT so you must delay pulling trumps until after you ruff the first !H. Win the !DA and immediately play !HA, !HK and ruff a !H with a high !C. West discards on this !H play. Enter dummy with a trump and ruff another !H high. The suit is now established, so you pull trumps, enter dummy one last time with the !DK and discard that losing !S on the good !H8.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
And if they had split 3-3 this Plan would still have worked.

Auction: 1D pass 1H | pass 2C pass 3NT | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S4.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2     !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 2Total = 7
You need two more winners. They cannot possibly come from !Ss, !Hs, or !Cs since one defender must hold at least 4 cards in each of those suits. So your two extra winners must come from the !D suit.
There is no reason to hold up on the !S since the !H and !C suits also have just two stoppers. You win the !SA.
You best play next is to finesse the !DT. This may gain a trick by virtue of the finesse if West happens to hold the !DJ, but primarily you are working to establish the !D suit. Assume East wins the !DJ and returns a !S.
Again don't hold up. Take the !SK and lead another small !D, finessing with dummy's !DQ. Happily this time the finesse works, and even more happily both defenders follow suit. That means the rest of the !Ds are good and you make an overtrick.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
If looked different because of the two finesses you took.

Auction: pass pass 1C | pass 2C pass 3NT | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S4. East puts on the !SA and returns the !S8.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2     !H = 1  !D = 2    !C = 1Total = 6
Needing three more winners you are going to have to establish the !C suit. You are also going to have to be lucky!
You win the second !S and play your !CQ. West covers with the !CK. What do you do next?
 Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:S9,N:S7,S:SQ,S:S3]
You DUCK. If you take the !CA now you will never get back to dummy to enjoy those other !Cs. So let West have the !CK. You win his return, (probably a !S), and play !CJ, then !C9 to dummy's !CA. As long as !Cs split 3-2 you will get the three winners you need.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
West's play of the !CK may have made you want to jump up with the !CA, but you must stick to the original play of ducking one trick.

Auction: pass pass 1D | pass 1H pass 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S2. East puts on the !SJ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2     !H = 1  !D = 2    !C = 1Total = 6
You need three more winners. It is possible your fourth !D can be established, but that needs a 3-3 split. It's also possible that the !C finesse will work, and also the !H finesse. Since you need the !H finesse anyway you should go ahead and try to establish the !Hs. 
Win the first trick with your !SQ and play a low !H, ducking in dummy. East will no doubt win a cheap trick but no matter. When you next gain the lead play your other low !H and finesse the !HQ. Assume this wins (if it doesn't you will be going down for sure). Play the !HA and if both defenders follow your other 2 !Hs are good and your contract is made.
Click NEXT to see the full Deal and whether you made the contract or not. [NEXT]
[RESET]
But, it is your only chance to make the contract.

Auction: 1H | pass 3H pass 4H | pass pass pass pass |
Analysis:
Some pretty agressive bidding gets you to a challenging game. South is to play 4!H. West leads the !SK, overtaken by East's !SA. East returns a !S to West's !ST, and he then plays the !SQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 2     !H = 0  !D = 1    !C = 3Total = 6
With 2 tricks already gone you still have 4 losers. You could consider ruffing the 3 !C losers in dummy but that would just create a trump loser even when trumps are splitting 3-2. So it looks like you will have to establish the !D suit for discards. You could pull trumps and then play your !DQ, hoping the defenders will grab their !DA immediately. But unless they are real novices they will hold it up one round and you'll no longer be able to reach dummy.
The solution is to establish the !Ds before you use up dummy's !HK.
Ruff the third !S, then play !DQ, (which they will duck), and another !D, (which they will probably take). Win whatever they return, pull trumps ending in dummy, and enjoy your 3 !D winners.
Click NEXT to see the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]

Auction: 1NT | pass 2D pass 2H | pass 2NT pass 3NT | pass pass pass
Analysis:
North's 3!D bid was a transfer to !Hs, and his 2NT bid showed exactly 5 !Hs with an invitational strength hand. South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S6, you play dummy's !S9 and  East contributes the !S2.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 2     !H = 0  !D = 1    !C = 2Total = 5
The math is easy - you need 4 !H tricks. And you should be able to manage that by driving out the !HA. But the defenders will probably hold up one or two rounds when you play on !Hs, so you must have an outside entry to dummy. 
The !S Q J will provide that entry IF you make sure to win the first trick with your !SA as an unblocking move. If you don't do so then West will be able to keep you out of the dummy and away from those good !Hs.
Click NEXT to see the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
But if you win the first trick with the !SA, then dummy's !S Q J will provide a guaranteed entry to the good !Hs.

Auction: pass pass pass 1D | pass 1H pass 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S2, you play dummy's !S4 and  East plays the !S8.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 3     !H = 0  !D = 2    !C = 2Total = 7
Needing just two more winners it looks straightforward to establish dummy's !H suit. Suppose you win the !ST and play the !H9. If the defenders win this trick you are home free. You win their !S return with your !SA, then continue !Hs to drive out their last stopper while you still have the !SK as a dummy entry.
This won't work against good defenders, who will hold up on the first !H trick and win the second. Then when they continue !Ss you won't have another !H to return to dummy, so while you can use the !SK as an entry to establish the !Hs you will never get back to use the good ones.
Instead you should win the first trick with your !SA. Now when you attack !Hs a defensive holdup won't hurt you because you have TWO !S entries, the !SJ by a finesse and the !SK.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
So the !S finesse is an odds-on play to get a second dummy entry.

Auction: 2S X | pass 2NT pass 3D | pass 4D pass 5D | pass pass pass
Analysis:
3NT would have been a lot easier, but you didn't get there. South is to play 5!D. West leads the !ST.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 0     !H = 1  !D = 0    !C = 2Total = 3
The good news is that you only have one loser to get rid of. The bad news is that there doesn't seem to be a good place to put it.
Unlikely as it seems, your best candidate for establishment is dummy's !S8. West is marked with 3 !Ss, and having led the !ST there is a good chance that he also has the !S9. If so you can ruff it out.
Cover the !ST with dummy's !SJ, and when East plays one of his honors ruff in your hand. Play a trump to the !DT, East showing out. Lead the !SQ. East will be forced to play his other high honor, (if he doesn't you would discard a loser), and you ruff again. 
Back to dummy with the !DQ and ruff the !S2 with a high trump just to be safe. West drops the !S9 on this trick.
Pull West's last trump and enter dummy with the !HA and FINALLY discard a loser on the now established !S8.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Here you needed !S T 9 x to be with West if you were to make the contract so you played for just that holding.

Auction: pass pass 2C | pass 2NT pass 3S | pass 4S pass 4NT | pass 5D pass 6S | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 6!S. West leads the !S5.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 0     !H = 1  !D = 1    !C = 0Total = 2
First pull trumps with the !SA and !SQ, both defenders following. Next you must establish dummy's !C suit to get rid of one of your losers. If the suit splits 3-3 that will be easy since you have two dummy entries, one to get there to ruff the third !C and the other to get there to enjoy playing the winners. But !Cs will probably split 4-2 so the two entries won't be enough. Here's how to make the defenders help you establish the suit.
After pulling trumps, play the !C A K, then !DA. Next exit with a small !D.
Click NEXT to see the position. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:S6,N:S4,N:D8,N:D6,N:C4,N:C3,S:SA,S:SQ,S:DA,S:D5,S:CA,S:CK]
The defender who won the !D trick has a problem. If he plays another !D you will get a ruff-sluff, and if he plays a !H you will play for the !HQ and !HJ to be in different hands. So he will probably play a !C.
You ruff in your hand, play a trump to dummy's !SK and ruff the !C8, establishing the !C9 while you still have the !H entry. 
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
This was a combination of Suit Establishment and End-play. The lesson on Eliminations contains a lot more of this type of hand.

Auction: 1C pass 1H | pass 1S pass 2D | pass 2H pass 4H | pass pass pass
Analysis:
The bidding has gone as shown. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!H]
With 14 points you will insist on game, but you aren't strong enough to jump shift. So you bid 1!H. Partner rebids 1!S. What do you bid now? [BID 2!D]

Partner shows nothing extra. All you know now is that he doesn't have 4 !Hs. You know you want to be in game, but you aren't sure which game. If partner has 3 !Hs then 4!H would be good. If not though, 3NT would be good if he has a !D stopper. The way to find out what he has is with Fourth Suit Forcing. So you bid 2!D. Partner answers with 2!H. What do you bid now? [BID 4!H]

Partner tells you he has 3 !Hs. You bid the !H game.

Auction: 1D | pass 1H pass 1S | pass 2C pass 2NT | pass pass pass
Analysis:
You are the dealer. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!D]
With 13 points you open 1!D. Partner responds 1!H. What do you bid now? [BID 1!S]

Partner might be 4-4 in the Majors so you bid 1!S. Apparently he wasn't since he says 2!C. What do you bid now? [BID 2NT]

This is Fourth Suit Forcing and partner may or may not have a !C suit. You do not have 3 !Hs. You do have a !C stopper, so with a minimum hand you bid 2NT and partner passes.

Auction: 1C pass 1H | pass 1S pass 2D | pass 2NT pass 3NT | pass pass pass
Analysis:
The bidding has gone as shown. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!H]
With 14 points you will insist on game, but you aren't strong enough to jump shift. So you bid 1!H. Partner rebids 1!S. What do you bid now? [BID 2!D]

Partner shows nothing extra. All you know now is that he doesn't have 4 !Hs. You know you want to be in game, but you aren't sure which game. If partner has 3 !Hs then 4!H would be good. If not though, 3NT would be good if he has a !D stopper. The way to find out what he has is with Fourth Suit Forcing. So you bid 2!D. Partner answers with 2NT. What do you bid now? [BID 3NT]

Partner does not have 3 !Hs, but he does have !Ds stopped. So you bid 3NT.

Auction: 1D | pass 1S pass 2C | pass 2H pass 3NT | pass pass pass
Analysis:
You are the dealer. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!D]
You open your 5-card suit, 1!D. Partner responds 1!S. What do you bid now? [BID 2!C]

You might bid 1NT, but since you have a singleton you prefer to say 2!C.
Partner bids 2!H. What do you say? [BID 3NT]

This is Fourth Suit Forcing and partner is fishing for more information. You certainly don't have 3 of his !Ss so that is out. On the other hand, you have a double stopper in !Hs, so with 14 points you go right to 3NT.

Auction: 1H pass 1S | pass 2C pass 3NT | pass pass pass
Analysis:
The bidding has gone as shown. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!S]
You show your 4-card Major. Bid 1!S. Partner rebids 2!C. What do you say next? [BID 3NT]

You have a nice !D suit but don't bid it now. That would be FSF and partner would assume you didn't have a !D stopper. 
With 13 points, bid what you expect to make, 3NT. Partner passes.

Auction: 1H | pass 1S pass 2C | pass 2D pass 3C | pass 5C all pass
Analysis:
You are the dealer. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!H]
You open 1!H. As expected, partner responds 1!S. What do you bid now? [BID 2!C]

This is easy bidding so far. You bid your second 5-card suit, 2!C.
Partner says 2!D. What do you bid? [BID 3!C]

Partner's bid is FSF. He wants to know if you have 3 !Ss, (you don't), or if you can stop !Ds, (you can't). So you have to rebid one of your 5-carders, and you should bid the lower-ranking one. You bid 3!C and partner raises to 5!C.

Auction: 1H pass 1S | pass 2D pass 3C | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
The bidding has gone as shown. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!S]
You have 15 points and you respond 1!S. Partner rebids 2!D. What do you say next? [BID 3!C]

You would love to play 4!S if partner has 3 !Ss. Or, you would love partner to play 3NT if he has !Cs stopped.
So you say 3!C (FSF) to find out if either possibility exists. Partner does have !Cs stopped and bids 3NT.

Auction: 1D | pass 1S pass 2C | pass 3H pass 4H | pass pass pass
Analysis:
You are the dealer. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!D]
With both 4-card minors you open 1!D. Partner responds 1!S. What do you bid next? [BID 2!C]

You cannot bid 2!H since you are not strong enough to reverse, so you bid 2!C.
Partner jumps to 3!H. What do you bid? [BID 4!H]

Since partner jumped this is NOT FSF. Partner has a !H suit and a pretty good hand to go with it. You also have a !H suit so you bid 4!H.

Auction: 1H pass 1S | pass 2D pass 4H | pass pass pass
Analysis:
The bidding has gone as shown. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!S]
You have a totally square 13 points. Still, you don't want to ignore a 4-card !S suit so you respond 1!S. Partner rebids 2!D. What do you say next? [BID 4!H]

You COULD bid 3!C, FSF, to find out if partner has a !C stopper but that would be pointless. You already know of an 8-card !H fit so you say 4!H.

Auction: 1D | pass 1S pass 2C | pass 2H pass 2S | pass 4S all pass
Analysis:
You are the dealer. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!D]
With both 4-card minors you open 1!D. Partner responds 1!S. What do you bid now? [BID 2!C]

You cannot support !Ss with only 3 of them. Instead you bid 2!C. Partner says 2!H. What do you bid now? [BID 2!S]

This is FSF, asking you to further describe your hand, and you have a problem. You do have a !H stopper so you COULD bid 2NT. You also have 3 !Ss so you COULD bid 2!S. Either way might turn out best, but that !HK looks pretty lonesome so you choose 2!S and partner raises to 4!S.

Auction: 1H pass 2C | pass 2D pass 2S | pass 2NT pass 3NT | pass pass pass
Analysis:
The bidding has gone as shown. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 2!C]
You respond 2!C. Partner rebids 2!D. What is your next bid? [BID 2!S]

With 13 HCP and that !C suit you could jump to 4!C. However, that would sail you right past 3NT which is very likely to turn out your best game. Rather than rebid !Cs, find out whether partner has !Ss stopped by using FSF.
You bid 2!S and partner then says 2NT. Where do you go from here? [BID 3NT]

It couldn't have worked out better. Notrump played from partner's side. You bid 3NT.

Auction: 1C | pass 1D pass 1H | pass 1S pass 2S | pass 4S all pass
Analysis:
You are the dealer. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!C]
There is only one possibility; you open 1!C. Partner responds 1!D. What do you bid now? [BID 1!H]

You rebid "up-the-line", so you now say 1!H. Partner says 1!S. What do you bid? [BID 2!S]

Be careful! This is NOT Fourth Suit Forcing. It is true that you are forced to bid, but the difference is that in this sequence partner has a real !S suit. With 4-card support you bid 2!S and partner raises to 4!S.

Auction: 1H pass 1S | pass 2C pass 2D | pass 2S pass 4S | pass pass pass
Analysis:
The bidding has gone as shown. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!S]
You have 13 points and you respond 1!S. Partner rebids 2!C. What is your next bid? [BID 2!D]

You have !Ds stopped, and with your 13 points you might well jump to 3NT. And while you may end up at 3NT it can't hurt to find out if partner has 3 !Ss first. So you bid 2!D, FSF. 
Partner says 2!S, telling you he has three of them, and you bid 4!S.

Auction: 1C | pass 1H pass 1S | pass 2D pass 3H | pass 4H all pass
Analysis:
You are the dealer. Decide what you would say, then click on BID above. [BID 1!C]
You have 15 points and you open 1!C. Partner responds 1!H. What do you bid now? [BID 1!S]

Show your 4-card Major, bid 1!S. Partner says 2!D. What do you bid now? [BID 3!H]

This is FSF, asking you to further describe your hand. Since you have 3 !Hs you will naturally let partner know that. But, your hand is so good you should jump to 3!H. Remember that partner may be bidding with only 12 points.
He was pretty weak, but with your jump finds enough to say 4!H.

Auction: 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !HQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 0    !H = 2  !D = 4    !C = 1 Total = 7
Needing two more winners you will have to make both the !SK and !SQ. This will only be possible if West holds the !SA. Win the first trick (if you don't West might switch to !Cs) and play a small !S toward dummy's !SQ. It holds the trick.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:SQ,N:H4,S:S4,S:HK]
You should take your four !D winners now, being sure to end up in your hand. Then play another small !S toward dummy's !SK. This also wins.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:SK,N:DA,N:DQ,N:D7,N:D3,S:S6,S:DK,S:DJ,S:DT,S:D2]
You have now won 7 tricks so don't mess around now. Take your two Aces and let them have the last four tricks.
Click NEXT to see the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
A Simple Finesse has only a 50% success rate. That's why we only take finesses as a last resort.

Auction: 1H pass 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !D3.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 5  !D = 1    !C = 1 Total = 8
You need just one more winner. Since West probably has 4 !Ds you will not be able to establish a trick in that suit, so your only hope is the !SQ. You win the first !D so they don't get a chance to switch to !Cs, a suit you are worse off in. Then take your 5 !H tricks, ending in dummy.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:HA,N:HK,N:HQ,N:HJ,N:H4,N:DA,S:S7,S:HT,S:H6,S:D2,S:C4,S:C3]
You can't put it off any longer so play a small !S from dummy and put the !SQ on. If it wins you will make your contract, if it loses you won't.
Click NEXT to find out which. [NEXT]
But remember, finesses only work half the time. The other half they lose.

Auction: pass pass 2NT | pass 3C pass 3D | pass 3NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !HQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 0    !H = 2  !D = 2    !C = 4 Total = 8
Needing one more winner you should see right away that it cannot come from !Hs, !Ds, or !Cs. That means you must hope that East has the !SA. Win the first !H, then play your 4 !C winners ending in dummy.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:H2,N:CK,N:CJ,N:C5,N:C2,S:HK,S:CA,S:CQ,S:C8,S:C7]
The moment of truth. You lead a small !S from dummy. East plays low and you play the !SK.
Unfortunately West takes your !SK with the !SA. He then plays another !H and you at least make 8 tricks but have no hope for a ninth one so you go down 1.
Click NEXT to see the bad news. [NEXT]
Welcome to the real world.

Auction: 1H | pass 2H pass 4H | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 4!H. West leads the !SK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 2    !H = 1  !D = 0    !C = 1 Total = 4
West found the best opening lead for his side, exposing your !S losers before you could establish the !C suit for a discard. If you start to pull trumps right away the defense will grab the !HA, then take their two !S tricks and you will still have the !CA that you cannot avoid.
Other than the !DA the only useful card in dummy is the !DQ so you must try to make a winner out of that for a  discard. So win the !SA, lead your singleton !D and finesse the !DQ. Your luck has returned, the !DQ wins and you discard one of your !S losers on the !DA.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:S2,N:DA,N:DQ,S:SA,S:S4,S:D8]
At this point you have not lost any tricks, and you can see that you have only 3 losers remaining in your hand. So you start pulling trumps and establishing the !Cs.
Clickfor the complete deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
The risk was worthwhile though since it gave you your only chance of making the contract.

Auction: 1C pass 2NT | pass 6NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 6NT. West leads the !S3.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 4    !H = 1  !D = 5    !C = 1 Total = 11
You need one more winner from the !H or !C suit. The straight finesse of the !HK offers a 50% chance of success. The double finesse of the !C K Q offers a 75% chance of success. It's a no-brainer. Run 4 !Ss and 5 !Ds ending in your hand. Be very careful not to discard a !C from your hand.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:SA,N:SQ,N:SJ,N:S2,N:H7,N:H6,N:DA,N:DK,N:D5,S:SK,S:S9,S:S5,S:H2,S:DQ,S:DJ,S:DT,S:D8,S:D7]
Lead a small !C and play the !CT if West plays low. Let's say East wins the !CK and returns a !H.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:CT,S:C3]
DO NOT FINESSE THE !H. Stick with your original 75% plan. Take the !HA and play your small !C, finessing the !CJ. This is why you couldn't discard a !C earlier.
Click NEXT to see the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
The double !C finesse is much better because its success depends on West holding either of two cards, the !CQ OR the !CK.

Auction: 2C | pass 2D pass 2S | pass 2NT pass 4S | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 4!S. West leads the !DK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 1    !H = 1  !D = 1    !C = 1 Total = 4
West has made another great lead. Any other suit would have given you a free finesse. You should duck the first !D. It is very possible that West has led from !D K Q T and will be afraid to continue for fear you have the !DJ in your hand. You'd be very happy to see him switch to any other suit. But he doesn't, he continues with the !DQ which you take with dummy's !DA.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:DA,N:D3,S:D8,S:D4]
You are in dummy for the first, last, and only time. You need to try a finesse right now, but which one? At first you might think it makes no difference but, in fact, there is only one reasonable choice. If you finesse the !SK successfully you may still have a !S loser. If you finesse the !HK successfully you will surely still have a !H loser. But if you finesse the !CK successfully you will eliminate your !C loser.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
But as you can see, only the !C finesse will actually save you a trick.

Auction: 1S | pass 3S pass 4NT | pass 5H pass 6S | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 6!S. West leads the !HK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 0    !H = 1  !D = 2    !C = 0 Total = 3
Your only hope for ridding yourself of two of those losers is dummy's !C suit. One possibility would be to finesse West for the !CK, and if that works, discard your !H loser on the !CA. You could then establish another !C winner for one of the !D losers. The problem with that plan is that if the finesse fails the defense will immediately take the setting !H trick.
A better plan is a ruffing finesse. Win the first trick with your !HA and pull trumps with your !S K Q. 
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:S7,N:S3,N:H6,S:SK,S:SQ,S:HA]
Next play your !C7 to dummy's !CA. Then lead the !CQ from dummy. If East plays the !CK you will ruff, enter dummy, and discard two red losers on the !C J T. If East plays low instead, you discard your !H loser. West may be able to win the trick but you can ruff a !H return, and dummy will have two good !Cs on which you can discard 2 !D losers.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
But they are easy to overlook, mainly because we don't use them often.

Auction: 1D pass pass 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !DK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 4 Total = 8
You only need one more winner. If East has the !SK you can finesse him out of it. Or, you have a two-way finesse for the !HQ.
It is an easy choice. The defenders only have 12 HCP and West opened the bidding. So you know he must have both of the cards you are interested in.
Hold up the !DA until the third round just to be safe. Then play four rounds of !Cs ending in your hand.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:D7,N:D6,N:D3,N:CA,N:CK,N:C6,N:C5,S:DA,S:DT,S:D4,S:CQ,S:CJ,S:C9,S:C2]
Now play the !HJ. If West doesn't cover, you will let it ride for your ninth trick. But West does cover so you take dummy's !HA, then your other 2 !H tricks. The !SA  is your ninth trick.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Sometimes that may be right. But there are other times when information from the bidding or the opening lead allows you to make a higher-percentage guess.

Auction: 1C pass 1S | pass 2S pass 4S | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 4!S. West leads the !H5. The defense wins 3 !H tricks, then switches to a !D.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:HT,N:H9,N:H6,N:D5,S:H7,S:H4,S:H2,S:DK]
Losers:   !S = ?    !H = 3  !D = 0    !C = 0 Total = 3 ?
You have already lost the 3 !H tricks so you must pick up the trump suit without loss. The odds aren't in your favor, but you have no choice but to play West for the doubleton King.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Lead a small !S from your hand and when West plays low put on the !SJ. When this holds the trick plunk down the !SA and hope.
Clickfor the complete Deal to see if the !SK dropped or not. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Look what would have occurred if you had started with the !SQ. West would have covered with the !SK (if he had it) and you would have lost a trick to the !ST later. 
The only hope is to try to drop the !SK without wasting an extra honor.

Auction: pass 1H | pass 1NT pass 4H | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 4!H. West leads the !DA. The defenders take two !D tricks, then switch to a trump.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:HQ,N:D5,N:D4,S:H2,S:DQ,S:DJ]
Losers:   !S = 0    !H = 0  !D = 2    !C = 2 Total = 4
The status is pretty clear, you've already lost the 2 !Ds so you have to keep your !C losers to just one. You have a good chance of pulling that off by playing for the !CK and !CQ to lie in different hands and taking two finesses.
But you will only be in dummy once more so you MUST make the first finesse right now. Play a small !C from dummy and play the !CT. West wins with the !CQ and plays another trump.
  Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:HA,N:C2,S:H4,S:CT]
In dummy for the last time you must now take your second !C finesse. You play a small !C to your !CJ. When the !CJ wins you pull any leftover trumps and your hand is good.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
It was probably a better example of watching your entries. If you had pulled another trump before taking that first !C finesse you would not have been able to take the second one.

Auction: pass 1D | pass 2D pass 3H | pass 5D pass 6D | pass pass pass
Analysis:
South is to play 6!D. West leads the !CK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 2    !H = 2  !D = 0    !C = 0 Total = 4
You don't really have 2 !H losers since both of them can be ruffed in dummy. The 2 !S losers are real, though, and must be dealt with. If East holds the !SK then a simple finesse will win the contract for you. A 50% chance. But there is more to this Deal than a simple finesse, look at it carefully.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
In addition to the trumps, dummy has another useful card, the !HJ. You can give yourself a second chance by playing West to hold the !HQ.
Ruff the opening !C lead, pull trumps with the !DK, (they split 1-1), and play a low !H toward the !HJ. West fidgets, then puts on the !HQ and plays another !C which you ruff.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:H6,N:D2,N:C7,N:C6,S:H5,S:DK,S:D6,S:D3]
You are in control now. You play a !H to dummy's !HJ, then a !S back to your !SA. Discard dummy's 2 !S losers on the !H A K and claim your slam.
Click NEXT to see that this was the only way it would make this time. [NEXT]
Then you would have to rely on the !S finesse after all. You'd be no worse off because you could still discard one of dummy's !Ss on a big !H.
This method of play gave you two chances instead of just one.

Auction: 2NT | pass 4C pass 4NT | pass 7NT pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 7NT. West leads the !ST.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 4    !H = 2  !D = 4    !C = 2 Total = 12
A. Conan Doyle would have called this "The Tale of Two Queens". You need to find one more trick and to do so you are going to have to find either the !HQ or the !CQ. You can finesse East for the !HQ, and you can finesse either defender for the !CQ.
So which will you choose?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Neither, yet. First take your 8 winners in !Ss and !Ds, hoping somebody discards something to help you. They don't.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:SK,N:SJ,N:S7,N:DA,N:DJ,N:DT,N:D8,N:C6,S:SA,S:SQ,S:S5,S:S3,S:DK,S:DQ,S:C7,S:C2]
Now play the !CA, then !CK, hoping the !CQ falls. If she does you have your thirteenth trick in !Cs. If she doesn't you take the !HK then finesse East for the !HQ. Two chances.
Click NEXT to see what happened. [NEXT]
It always pays to look for a second chance. Here you try to drop the !CQ, and if it doesn't work you have the finesse for the !HQ in reserve. 
Why not try to drop the !HQ and keep the finesse for the !CQ in reserve? Because you and dummy had 8 !Cs between you and only 6 !Hs. So the !CQ was far more likely to be doubleton than the !HQ.

Auction: 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !H3.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 0    !H = 2  !D = 2    !C = 4 Total = 8
First things first. Win the first !H, do not hold up. West's !H3 indicates he has led a 4-card suit so a hold-up wouldn't help you. And if you did hold up they might pocket their !H trick and switch to !Ds, a suit you are no better off in.
You need to get one more winner and it will have to be a !S winner. You could lead toward the !SQ, winning a trick if West holds BOTH the !SA and !SK. Or you could finesse the !ST, gaining a trick if West holds the !SJ. Obviously the second choice is more likely.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Having won the first !H trick in your hand, play a small !S and finesse the !ST. Suppose East wins the !SK and returns a !H. Take your !HA and play another !S, going up with the !SQ if West plays low. If the !SQ wins, take your 9 tricks and run.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Whenever the !SA and !SK are in different hands, the only thing that matters is the location of the !SJ. 
So it is basically a 50% chance.

Auction: 2NT | pass 3C pass 3S | pass 4S pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 4!S. West leads the !D2. The defenders win 3 !D tricks, then play a !C.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:D8,N:D6,N:D4,N:C3,S:DQ,S:D5,S:D3,S:CJ]
Losers:   !S = 0 or 1    !H = 0  !D = 3    !C = 0 Total = 3 or 4
Since you have already lost 3 !D tricks you cannot also lose a !S trick. That means East will have to have the !SK and it also means that you will have to be careful with your finessing.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
In your hand with a !C you play over to dummy's !HA. Now lead the !SQ from dummy and when East plays low play the !SJ (or T) from your hand.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:SQ,N:HA,S:ST,S:H4]
The !SQ held the trick so you are still in dummy. Play the !S9, and when East doesn't cover, play your !S8 under it. West shows out on this trick and you are glad you played so carefully. Play one more !S, finessing East's !SK again, then play your !SA and the rest of your winners.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
True, the chances of East holding 4 !Ss to the King are pretty small, but it costs you nothing to protect yourself against that holding. 
And the rewards are great.

Auction: 1D | pass 2C pass 3NT | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !H7. East takes the !HA and returns the !H2. Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT] [PLAY N:HT,N:H5,S:HK,S:H4] Winners: !S = 3 !H = 1 !D = 3 !C = 1 Total = 8 You need one more winner and !Cs is your best suit. If the !CK is in West's hand you can finesse it for 12 tricks. But if the !CK is in East's hand you will lose that trick and at least 4 !Hs. Before you put all your eggs in the !C finesse basket there is one thing you should do first. Click NEXT. [NEXT] You should test the !D suit by playing !DQ, !DK, !DA. Both defenders follow three times and your !D6 has become a winner, which you cash. Click NEXT. [NEXT] [PLAY N:DQ,N:D7,N:D2,N:C5,S:DA,S:DK,S:D6,S:D5] Now you have a problem. You have won 5 tricks so far and you have 4 more winners ready to take. So you can take your 9 tricks and run, or you can finesse the !C trying for 3 overtricks.

It's your decision, but click NEXT to see how your decision would have turned out.

[NEXT] But at Match Point Pairs the reward would be much greater, a probable very high board. Of course with this layout it might have gotten you a bottom board.

Auction: 1D | pass 2D pass 3NT | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !HQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 3 Total = 7
You need two more winners and !Ds is your longest combined suit. But you can only establish one extra winner in !Ds, and before you could even do that the defenders would have taken a bunch of !H tricks.
So you must turn to the !Ss for the extra two winners.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:H2,S:HK]
You win the first !H and lead . . . which !S? If you play the !SQ you will go down, even if West has the !SK. He would cover and you would be held to just 2 !S tricks.
The only way to get 3 tricks from this holding is to play East for the !SK. So play a !S to dummy's !SA and then a small !S back toward your !S Q J. Here East puts the !SK on and you are home-free.
Clickfor the full Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
If it had not dropped you would just have played a third round of !Ss, hoping for a 3-3 split in the suit.
Clickagain. [NEXT]

Auction: 1C pass 2NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !CA, then !CK, !C2. East follows once, then discards a !S and a !H.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:C9,N:C6,N:C3,S:CJ,S:C7,S:C4]
East follows once, then discards a !S and a !H.
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 3  !D = 2    !C = 2 Total = 8
There are two possibilities for getting an extra winner. If the !Ds are splitting 3-3 you could play !DA, !DK and another !D and establish the thirteenth !D as a winner. Or you could play East for the !SK and lead toward your !SQ.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
The chance of East holding the !SK is a little greater than 50%. (it is higher than the usual 50% because we know he started with only one !C, giving him more spaces for other cards).
The chance of !Ds splitting 3-3 is about 40%.
So you should enter dummy with a !H and play a small !S toward your !SQ.
Did it work? Click NEXT to see. [NEXT]
The problem is that you might run into this very distribution. You would establish a !D for East and when you played a !S from dummy East would jump up with the !SK and cash his winning !D for down 1.

Auction: 1D pass pass 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !DK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 2  !D = 1    !C = 4 Total = 8
You only need one more winner. If East has the !SK or the !HQ a simple finesse will give you the trick.
There are two problems though. The first one is that if West gets in he may take too many !D tricks. But the bigger problem is that East cannot possibly have either of those two high cards. You and dummy together hold 28 HCP and West must surely hold the other 12 since he opened the bidding. Neither simple finesse will work so you must try what is called a Backward Finesse.
Hold up the !DA until the third round to confirm that East has only 2. He does. Then play four rounds of !Cs ending in your hand.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:D7,N:D6,N:D3,N:CA,N:CK,N:C6,N:C5,S:DA,S:DT,S:D4,S:CQ,S:CJ,S:C9,S:C2]
Now play the !HJ. If West doesn't cover, you will let it ride for your ninth trick. But West does cover so you must take dummy's !HA. Next play a small !H from dummy and finesse the !H9, hoping East has the !HT. This is the Backward Finesse.
Clickfor the complete Deal to see if it worked. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Like this time.
By the way. Those of you with great short-term memories might think they have seen this hand before. Well, you ALMOST have. Deal 8 has an almost identical layout but a much simpler theme. Check it out.

Auction: pass 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S5, East plays the !SQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:S2,S:S6]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 2  !D = 2    !C = 3 Total = 8
Before worrying about where that one winner is going to come from you need to decide what to do with the opening lead. A good guideline is to hold up unless you fear a switch. Here, with all other suits well protected you would welcome a switch, so you let East win the !SQ. East then plays the !S8. Do you hold up again?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:S4,S:S7]
It probably doesn't matter, but since you cannot possibly win more than T tricks you might just as well hold up again. West wins the !SJ then plays the !S3. East discards a !H on the third !S.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:ST,S:SA]
OK, now it is time to figure out where that extra trick is coming from. Not much figuring is needed, it must come from the !D suit. Since you are missing 5 cards including the Queen, the odds favor a finesse over playing for the drop. And, since you have the option of finessing either defender are you going to finesse into the one who can set you or into the safe one?
Silly question. Of course you play the !DK from your hand, then a small !D finessing dummy's !DT, which wins the trick - and the game - and the overtrick.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
But in a situation like this you don't play odds. By finessing West you guaranteed making the contract even if the finesse lost because East had no more !Ss. Even a losing !D finesse would have established the one trick you needed.

Auction: 2C pass 2NT | pass 3C pass 3S | pass 4NT pass 5D | pass 6S pass pass | pass
Analysis:
South is to play 6!S after North's Stayman bid. West leads the !HQ.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 0    !H = 1  !D = 0    !C = 1 Total = 2
This looks like a very simple plan. Since the hands have mirrored distribution there will be no discards anywhere. That means the !CK MUST be in West's hand or you will go down. But is that all there is to it?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
If West has !C K x or !C K x x then yes, that's all there is to it. But if he has !C K x x x then you won't have enough entries to your hand unless you take the first !C finesse BEFORE you start on trumps.
So win the !HA and immediately play a !C to dummy's !CJ, which holds the trick. Then pull trumps, (it takes 4 rounds), ending in your hand.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
[PLAY N:SA,N:SQ,N:SJ,N:S9,N:CJ,S:SK,S:S7,S:S5,S:S3,S:HA,S:C3]
Next play your !CT, putting on the !C5 from dummy when West plays low again. This lets you stay in your hand to play another !C to the !CQ, picking up all four !C tricks and the slam.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
But also you had to play to one of dummy's honors first so you could retain that !C5 for letting you stay in your hand to make the third finesse. Bridge is great.

When you ask partner to make a judgement call and he does so, you don't then override that call. You pass.

The bidding has gone as shown. Decide what you would say next, then click on BID above. [BID 4!H]

Partner has invited you to bid game and you have 10 points, an absolute maximum. But, he has also told you he is worried about !Cs and your help in that suit is rather nebulous.
Since you have to make a judgement one way or the other you should decide that a Queen is a little bit of Help and with the 10 points that should be enough. You bid 4!H.

You bid 3!H, a bid not covered in the Summary, but which you hope partner will interpret as meaning: "I can't help you in !Ds, but I have some great !Hs."

Auction: 3H 3NT | pass pass pass | |
Analysis:

You may not agree with South's 3NT bid but how else are you going to get to the only game that has a chance of making?
You need 3 extra winners and they will come from the !C suit even if West holds the !CK and wins your finesse. You may think about holding up on the !HA for one round just to make sure West has none if he wins the !CK.
That would be a mistake. It is almost certain that East has a 7-card !H suit for his preemptive opening. This is confirmed by West's lead of the !H4, with a doubleton he would have led a higher card. So there is no need to hold up. But . . . it couldn't hurt, could it?

Yes, it could hurt real bad!Suppose East has nothing in his hand but the !H K Q J T 8 7 6 that you already know about. When you let his !HT win the first trick he will realize that his hand is dead. And he may be smart enough, (or lucky enough), to switch to a !S.

But one of the important considerations you have to think about is the possibility that the Defense will switch to another suit - where you might be in even more trouble.
You'd feel bad on this hand if you let East hold the !HT only to see him next lay down the !SJ.

You will need to discard a loser on dummy's fourth !D, but you must do so without ever letting West gain the lead since West is the defender who can lead through dummy's !HK. And the only card that West can get the lead with is the !CQ.
Hold-ups are usually used in notrump hands, but here you use one to prevent the Danger Hand from gaining the lead. Let East have the !CK. He cannot play a red card without helping you so he will surely play another !C. 
Click NEXT. [NEXT]

East will win this but he is helpless. Whatever he plays you will be able to discard a !H loser on dummy's !D.

Auction: 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !HK. East plays the !H6.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]

You just need one more winner and it could come from the !D suit if it happens to split 3-3. But you have another possibility. Suppose you let West hold the first trick and he decides to play another !H? You would have two !H winners.
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
This isn't a true hold-up play although it does look like one. This play has the rather fancy name of Bath Coup, (named from Bath, England). Presumably West has led from !H K Q T 9 5 and East has played his singleton !H6. If West realizes that East has played his lowest card he will take that as a discouraging signal and will play a different suit. So you throw out your !H7 rather than the !H3. Now West may think that East is encouraging him to continue, just what you want.
Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Because if he doesn't you're going to have to end-play him.
Do you see how that might happen?

[PLAY N:SQ,N:S4,N:DK,N:DJ,N:DT,N:D3,S:SA,S:S5,S:DA,S:DQ,S:D6,S:D5]
You need one trick from the !C suit, so you win 4 !D tricks, then the !SA, !SQ, putting you in dummy. Next you play a !C from dummy, and when East plays low you put on . . . which !C?
This is not a guess. If West has the !CA he will get the lead and when he does he will set you with 2 more !H tricks. So you assume that East has the !CA and play your !CK.
Click to see if your smart play is rewarded. [NEXT]
But it's not enough to just be smart enough to hold up, you must also be able to figure out how to make the best plays later as well.

Auction: 1S | pass 2S pass 4S | pass pass pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 4!S. West leads the !DQ. East plays the !D9.
Make a Plan, then click . [NEXT]
Losers:   !S = 1    !H = 0  !D = 1    !C = 2 Total = 4
On the plus side dummy has an extra !H winner on which you could discard a loser from your hand. The danger is that when you take the trump finesse, West might win the !SK and put his partner in the lead with the !DK for a !C play through your !CK.
To prevent that from happening all you have to do is hold up on the first !D. You have to lose one trick in the suit no matter what, so lose it right now to West, the Safe Hand. West continues with another !D which you win.
Click . [NEXT]
[PLAY N:D5,N:D3,S:DA,S:D8]
You go over to dummy with a !H and play the !SQ, letting it ride. West wins with his !SK, but cannot play !Cs from his side of the table without handing you a trick. Whatever else he plays you win, pull trumps, and discard a !C loser on dummy's fourth !H.
Click for the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
At suit contracts the most common reason for a hold-up is to keep the Danger Hand from getting the lead.

Auction: 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !HK.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 3    !H = 1  !D = 0    !C = 4 Total = 8
Unless there is a miracle in the !Ds, (or a defensive error), you can't get a trick in that suit. But you have a chance for a second !H trick.
It's the Bath Coup again, just dressed up a little differently. 
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
Let West hold the first trick, playing the !H7 from your hand to conceal the !H4 in the hope that West will continue the suit. If he does you have your ninth trick - if he doesn't, good luck.
Click NEXT to see the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]

Auction: 1NT | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
South is to play 3NT. West leads the !S7.
Make a Plan, then click NEXT. [NEXT]
Winners:   !S = 1    !H = 2  !D = 3    !C = 0 Total = 6
It's pretty clear that your extra tricks are going to have to come from the !C suit. The danger here is that West may have a 5-card !S suit that he can establish and the !CA as an entry. So what is the best approach, hold up or not hold up?
Click NEXT. [NEXT]
To answer that question you must think about West's lead. Since he did not lead the !SK you know he doesn't have a suit headed by K Q J. So you can visualize East sitting there with a doubleton honor in !Ss. It might be !S K x, !S Q x or !S J x, but it is surely one of those three.
Think what East will do if you duck in dummy. He will play his honor, win the trick, and clear the suit by leading his small x. If West can get in with the !CA he will run the !Ss.
But what will East do if you play dummy's !SA? If he plays his small one the !S suit will block. If he unblocks his honor card then your !S T 9 5 3 will provide a second stopper in the suit. So you go up with dummy's !SA and guarantee the contract.
Clickfor the complete Deal. [NEXT]
[RESET]
Of course from now on you will recognize it.

You have a bare-minimum hand, but at least you have a 6-card suit which you can rebid. You say 2!H and partner raises to 4!H.

Auction: 1H | pass 1S pass 2S | pass pass pass | |
Analysis: [BID 1!H]\nYou open 1!H and partner responds 1!S. It is your bid again. [BID 2!S]\nYou have good !S support but you must tell partner of your minimum hand. So you bid 2!S and he passes.

Auction: 1H | pass 1S pass 3S | pass 4S pass pass | pass |
Analysis:
[BID 1!H]
Naturally you open 1!H. Partner responds 1!S. What do you say next? [BID 3!S]
Partner has at least 4 !Ss and you have 4. So you have found the 8-card Major fit. Now it is a question of finding the right level. Your job is to further describe your hand as either minimum, medium, or maximum. With 17/18 points (revalued) you are a medium, so you jump to 3!S.
Partner bids the game.

Auction: 1S | pass 2C pass 2H | pass 3NT pass pass | pass |
Analysis: [BID 1!S]\nOf course you open 1!S. Partner responds 2!C. What is your next bid? [BID 2!H]\nPartner has shown at least 11 points and you are forced to bid again. Since the !Hs rank below !Ss you can bid them with your minimum hand. Apparently that is just what partner wanted to hear since he jumps to 3NT which you happily pass.

Auction: 1S | pass 2H pass 4H | pass pass pass | |
